name: Casa Del Toro Bed & Breakfast

reviews.text: Just came back from a three day weekend to visit my son. Santa Fe was crowded and hotels booked (with inflated prices) due to wine and chili festival. I tried this B and B based on the reasonable price, location, and photos/videos on their web site. Wow! What a great surprise. Charming compound, friendly, dedicated staff, very relaxed and easy-going. Most excellent home-cooked breakfasts.
reviews.title: Very Pleasantly Surprised

likes.liked: — Quiet location; safe, friendly and charming.

reviews.text: I had the small, second story room, with a little deck. Perfect for one or two people. The deck offers lovely rooftop views; enjoyed early morning sun and sunset. Beautifully tiled bathroom, remodeled and spacious. Little fridge and sink perfect for snacks.
reviews.title: Casa Del Toro/Casitas on McKenzie Street

likes.liked: — convenience for a large group of families. Has a Washer/Dryer available for customers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My neighbors, many of whom attended the festival, invited me for wine and conversation on the main patio at night.
reviews.title: The Perfect Location And Ambience

likes.liked: — loved the privacy, the location, the cleanliness, and the friendliness of the hosts
likes.disliked: — breakfast ended too early for us... would have liked a jacuzzi in the 'rustic' room....

reviews.text: The location is splendid: now my favorite neighborhood in Santa Fe. Walk to center of town in minutes, yet it's tucked away enough to be out of the hustle of tourism. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Annual Santa Fe Opera Visit
A very relaxed feel good bed and breakfast
reviews.text: We had 12 adults and 4 children (1 2yr old and 3 1 year olds) and Paul arranged for us to have 5 Casita's sharing a small courtyard, which was perfect. All the Casita's had kitchenettes, bedrooms and sitting areas and two were big enough for all of us to meet together. Paul was very helpful (checking in on us, making sure we were comfortable, providing cribs and making other special arrangements for such a large group) and the breakfasts were excellent (I don't know how to eat breakfast without salsa anymore). The chef never forgot to prepare something special for one of us who is on a gluten-free diet.

My family, including my husband and two kids, visited last winter. We thought, to our dismay, that we were in for a great stay. That is, until the furnace in our McKenzie house went out. The owner Bruce was out of town due to his father's passing. We understood that, but Bruce is not the maintenance man-and he did not have one!! You would think that a multi unit establishment would have someone available to do repairs. There was NO ONE AROUND to fix the furnace!! There was a fireplace but NO WOOD AROUND! The only person we had to call was a very friendly lady named Danita who was taking care of things as best as she could. She recruited one of the other tenants-someone actually staying there as a guest-to try to repair the furnace. All the while, my husband, who was sick, and my two kids were freezing. The kind lady tried bringing us space heaters, but the fusebox kept blowing from too much load. The lady in charge kept trying to call Bruce to ask him what to do about the furnace, but he never returned her phone calls, she left him many messages!! Doesn't it make sense to you intelligent people out there that a business owner would make himself available for property issues even if he is away? After two days we finally were so fed up we had to leave, and on top of everything else, we never received a refund for balance owed to us. In my opinion, not only is Bruce a horrible property manager, but a dishonest one as well.
reviews.title: freezing our butts off, broken heat, no maintenance man

reviews.text: 1. Breakfast was superb. We got a flavor of homemade New Mexican food- different every morning! And we really wish we had that granola recipe...
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. The staff members were always around to help out. They provided great advice about where to go when we wanted to hike, see pueblos, raft, get massages, etc.
reviews.title: Charming, Comfortable, Romantic and a GREAT DEAL!!!

likes.disliked: — Management was on lengthy phone calls both at check in and check out... SUPER friendly otherwise though!!

reviews.text: 3. Location was awesome. A couple blocks from the plaza, but in a residential neighborhood.
reviews.title: Unique B&B - I'll be back!

likes.disliked: — a few cockroaches shared our casita.

reviews.text: 4. It had character! Sometimes, hotels get to be so tiring- all the same inside. Casa del toro was just different, and we felt more at home there!
reviews.title: Just Super

likes.liked: — easy access to local attractions; cleanliness

reviews.title: A Delighful Stay
reviews.text: We were upgraded from a studio unit to a 3 + bedroom house. This enabled our (local) son's family of 5 to stay with us for a three-night sleep over. The place is great fun, with lots of wall color and interesting artifacts all about..The neighborhood has a peacefull, small-town (even small-foreign-town) kind of feel. This is amazing since you're only a 5 minute walk to the Santa Fe Plaza., and it makes Casa del Toro an outstanding value. We had their breakfast one morning, which was not included in our arrangement. It's served in this inviting breakfast house and the food is excellent, although the portions ran short. Highly recommended for those who enjoy a casual, engaging stay.

reviews.title: Relaxing and comfortable stay in Santa Fe
reviews.text: After spending a week driving and touring Sedona and the Grand Canyon it was wonderful to park the car and be able to stroll through the best parts of Santa Fe while staying here. Accommodations were good, food was great and the people you met at breakfast were very interesting. We like it so much we stayed here an extra night. Can’t wait to go back.

reviews.title: Loved it!!!
reviews.text: This was the most charming bed & breakfast I've ever stayed at. The breakfast was absolutely delicious - and I looked forward to eating along with the other guests' each morning and seeing how and what everyone was doing. Perfect location. The Plaza was literally like a block or so away. Close enough to go make a quick change and go right back. Loved the way it was decorated, and felt very comfortable and safe. I felt very 'at home' and drank a glass of wine on the front porch of the main house in VERY comfortable chairs. I was really pleased, and if I ever go back to Santa Fe, this is where I'm staying. :-)

reviews.title: A nice "home" after hotels
reviews.text: From the ease of booking the place, the great location just blocks from the plaza, the big and homey feel after being in hotel rooms to the cleanliness, I would recommend this to anyone going to Santa Fe.
I don't remember how I found it, but it was on-line.
reviews.title: Very accommodating

likes.liked: — Employees are very friendly and accommodating
likes.disliked: — Could make a few minor improvements to the rooms..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed at this B&B four times now and we love it. The management is very accommodating and friendly, the breakfast is wonderful (try the amazing granola). One of the innkeepers (Paul) was tremendously helpful when we were making reservations, and gave us a lot of information about things that we could do around Santa Fe. All in all the rooms, the people, and the food are great, but there are a few things they could improve on. For example, the insulation around the doors and windows could be improved. Also, the rooms on McKensie St. are very nice, but we stayed in a room once that was a few blocks down on Guadalupe which didn't have a comfortable bed and was rather small (but that was a few years back, so I don't know if they've improved or even still own those rooms). If you're planning on staying, make sure to ask for the McKensie rooms. But again, its well worth the stay and very family friendly. I highly recommend staying here.
reviews.title: Not What I expected

likes.disliked: — Didn't bother to accomdate our request for a vegetarian entree at breakfast

reviews.text: This B & B was rather diappointing as we booked late, and were put into a tiny room off to the side of the main house. The room had no place to sit, was small and dark.
reviews.title: Charmed to my toes
Great Escape!
reviews.text: We are vegetarians, and requested a vegetarian entree for breakfast. You can imagine how shocked we were to find that the main breakfast entree was a quiche with HAM in it! I was pretty upset as they were told in advance about our request.

aka: Casa Del Toro Hotel Santa Fe
description: An affordable bed and breakfast in the heart of the Santa Fe Plaza.
